sub_concepts.name: Continental Drift
sub_concepts.definition: A theory that the continents have drifted slowly over the surface of the Earth over geologic time.

sub_concepts.name: Seafloor Spreading
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which new oceanic lithosphere is created at mid-ocean ridges.

sub_concepts.name: Transform Boundary
sub_concepts.definition: A boundary between two tectonic plates that is characterized by lateral motion.

sub_concepts.name: Convergent Boundary
sub_concepts.definition: A boundary between two tectonic plates that are moving towards each other, which can result in the formation of mountain ranges or volcanic activity.

sub_concepts.name: Divergent Boundary
sub_concepts.definition: A boundary between two tectonic plates that are moving away from each other, which can result in the formation of mid-ocean ridges or rift valleys.

sub_concepts.name: Lithosphere
sub_concepts.definition: The rigid outer layer of the Earth, including the crust and the uppermost part of the mantle.

sub_concepts.name: Asthenosphere
sub_concepts.definition: The semi-fluid layer of the Earth's mantle below the lithosphere.

sub_concepts.name: Plate Motion
sub_concepts.definition: The movement of the large plates that make up the Earth's lithosphere.
